shortdesc.ph: Creates a data stream to improve reliability and ordering of data transmission.

p.codeblock: virtual int createDataStreamEx(int* streamId, bool reliable, bool ordered, const RtcConnection& connection) = 0;
public abstract int createDataStreamEx(boolean reliable, boolean ordered, RtcConnection connection);

dlentry.dd: This method is deprecated. Use instead.

section.note: Each user can create up to five data streams during the lifecycle of . The data streams are destroyed when leaving the channel. To continue using them, you need to recreate them.
Each user can create up to five data streams during the lifecycle of the . The data streams are destroyed when leaving the channel. To continue using them, you need to recreate them.

section.title: Scenario
section.p: This method applies to multi-channel scenarios.

section.title: Related Callbacks
section.p: After successfully calling this method, if reliable is set to and the receiver does not receive the data within five seconds, the SDK triggers the callback and returns an error code.
If reliable is set to and the receiver does not receive the data within five seconds, the SDK triggers the callback and returns an error code.

plentry.pd: Output parameter. The ID of the created data stream.

Whether to ensure the receiver receives the data stream within five seconds:
: The receiver will receive the sender's data within five seconds. If not, the SDK triggers the callback and returns an error code.
: The SDK does not guarantee the data stream is received within five seconds. Delays or losses will not return error information. Note: Make sure reliable and ordered are both or both .

Whether the data stream is received in the order it was sent:
: The receiver receives the data in the order it was sent.
: The receiver does not receive the data in order.

pd.note: Make sure reliable and ordered are both set to or both set to .
pd.ph: Whether to ensure the receiver receives the data stream within five seconds:

ul.li: : The receiver receives the data from the sender within five seconds. If not, the SDK triggers the callback and returns an error code.
: Does not guarantee delivery within five seconds. Delays or losses will not return error information.

plentry.pd:
Whether to receive the data stream in the order it was sent:
: The receiver receives the data in the order it was sent.
: The receiver does not receive the data in order.

ul.li: If the method call succeeds, returns the created data stream ID.
If the method call fails, returns a value less than 0.
